revised_title: Aldosterone Secretion and Hemorrhage: Investigating the Mechanisms
tldr: This study investigates the factors that influence aldosterone secretion during hemorrhage in dogs. The researchers found that acute hemorrhage led to a significant increase in aldosterone secretion in some dogs, while others showed no response. Factors such as surgical stress, low dietary sodium intake, and adrenal medullary hormones played a role in the response. The role of ACTH and renin as mediators of the action of hemorrhage on aldosterone secretion is further explored in part II.
